facts.fact_text: Brent crude oil futures rose over 1% to above $68 per barrel on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: Brent crude oil futures rose over 1% to above $68 per barrel on Friday, reversing earlier losses, as disagreements over the agenda in US–Iran high-stakes talks made progress uncertain.

facts.fact_text: Saudi Arabia cut prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia to the lowest level since late 2020.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, Saudi Arabia cut prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia to the lowest level since late 2020, signaling oversupply, though the smaller-than-expected reduction suggested confidence in demand.

claims.claim_text: Disagreements over the agenda in US–Iran high-stakes talks made progress uncertain.

claims.claim_text: Saudi Arabia's price cut signals oversupply.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, Saudi Arabia cut prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia to the lowest level since late 2020, signaling oversupply, though the smaller-than-expected reduction suggested confidence in demand.

claims.claim_text: Oil is heading for its first weekly decline in six weeks.

evidences.evidence_text: Still, oil is heading for its first weekly decline in six weeks.

evidence.evidence_text: Brent crude oil futures rose over 1% to above $68 per barrel on Friday, reversing earlier losses, as disagreements over the agenda in US–Iran high-stakes talks made progress uncertain.

Meanwhile, Saudi Arabia cut prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia to the lowest level since late 2020, signaling oversupply, though the smaller-than-expected reduction suggested confidence in demand.
